   19: %%
   20: -module(erl_prim_loader_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -include_lib("kernel/include/file.hrl").
   23: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   24: 
   25: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   26: 	 init_per_testcase/2,end_per_testcase/2,
   27: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2]).
   28: 
   29: -export([get_path/1, set_path/1, get_file/1, normalize_and_backslash/1,
   30: 	 inet_existing/1, inet_coming_up/1, inet_disconnects/1,
   31: 	 multiple_slaves/1, file_requests/1,
   32: 	 local_archive/1, remote_archive/1,
   33: 	 primary_archive/1, virtual_dir_in_archive/1,
   34: 	 get_modules/1]).
   35: 
   36: -define(PRIM_FILE, prim_file).
   37: 
   38: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
   39: %% Test suite for erl_prim_loader. (Most code is run during system start/stop.)
   40: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
   41: 
   42: suite() ->
   43:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   44:      {timetrap,{minutes,3}}].
   45: 
   46: all() -> 
   47:     [get_path, set_path, get_file,
   48:      normalize_and_backslash, inet_existing,
   49:      inet_coming_up, inet_disconnects, multiple_slaves,
   50:      file_requests, local_archive, remote_archive,
   51:      primary_archive, virtual_dir_in_archive,
   52:      get_modules].
   53: 
   54: groups() -> 
   55:     [].
   56: 
   57: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   58:     Config.
   59: 
   60: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   61:     ok.
   62: 
   63: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   64:     Config.
   65: 
   66: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   67:     Config.
   68: 
   69: 
   70: init_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
   71:     Config.
   72: 
   73: end_per_testcase(_Func, _Config) ->
   74:     ok.
   75: 
   76: get_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   77:     case erl_prim_loader:get_path() of
   78: 	{ok, Path} when is_list(Path) ->
   79: 	    ok;
   80: 	_ ->
   81: 	    ct:fail(get_path)
   82:     end,
   83:     ok.
   84: 
   85: set_path(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   86:     {ok, Path} = erl_prim_loader:get_path(),
   87:     ok = erl_prim_loader:set_path(Path),
   88:     {ok, Path} = erl_prim_loader:get_path(),
   89:     NewPath = Path ++ ["dummy_dir","/dummy_dir/dummy_dir"],
   90:     ok = erl_prim_loader:set_path(NewPath),
   91:     {ok, NewPath} = erl_prim_loader:get_path(),
   92: 
   93:     ok = erl_prim_loader:set_path(Path), % Reset path.
   94:     {ok, Path} = erl_prim_loader:get_path(),
   95: 
   96:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch erl_prim_loader:set_path(not_a_list)),
   97:     {ok, Path} = erl_prim_loader:get_path(),
   98:     ok.
   99: 
  100: get_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  101:     case erl_prim_loader:get_file("lists" ++ code:objfile_extension()) of
  102: 	{ok,Bin,File} when is_binary(Bin), is_list(File) ->
  103: 	    ok;
  104: 	_ ->
  105: 	    ct:fail(get_valid_file)
  106:     end,
  107:     error = erl_prim_loader:get_file("duuuuuuummmy_file"),
  108:     error = erl_prim_loader:get_file(duuuuuuummmy_file),
  109:     error = erl_prim_loader:get_file({dummy}),
  110:     ok.
  111: 
  112: get_modules(Config) ->
  113:     case test_server:is_cover() of
  114: 	false -> do_get_modules(Config);
  115: 	true -> {skip,"Cover"}
  116:     end.
  117: 
  118: do_get_modules(Config) ->
  119:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  120:     NotADir = atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ "_not_a_dir",
  121:     ok = file:write_file(filename:join(PrivDir, NotADir), <<>>),
  122:     ok = file:set_cwd(PrivDir),
  123: 
  124:     MsGood = lists:sort([lists,gen_server,gb_trees,code_server]),
  125:     Ms = [certainly_not_existing|MsGood],
  126:     SuccExp = [begin
  127: 		   F = code:which(M),
  128: 		   {ok,Code} = file:read_file(F),
  129: 		   {M,{F,erlang:md5(Code)}}
  130: 	       end || M <- MsGood],
  131:     FailExp = [{certainly_not_existing,enoent}],
  132: 
  133:     io:format("SuccExp = ~p\n", [SuccExp]),
  134:     io:format("FailExp = ~p\n", [FailExp]),
  135: 
  136:     Path = code:get_path(),
  137:     Process = fun(_, F, Code) -> {ok,{F,erlang:md5(Code)}} end,
  138:     {ok,{SuccExp,FailExp}} = get_modules_sorted(Ms, Process, Path),
  139: 
  140:     %% Test that an 'enotdir' error can be handled.
  141:     {ok,{SuccExp,FailExp}} = get_modules_sorted(Ms, Process, [NotADir|Path]),
  142: 
  143:     {ok, Peer, Node, BootPid} = complete_start_node(),
  144:     ThisDir = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
  145:     true = rpc:call(Node, code, add_patha, [ThisDir]),
  146:     _ = rpc:call(Node, code, ensure_loaded, [?MODULE]),
  147:     {ok,{InetSucc,FailExp}} = rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader,
  148: 				       get_modules, [Ms,Process,Path]),
  149:     SuccExp = lists:sort(InetSucc),
  150: 
  151:     peer:stop(Peer),
  152:     unlink(BootPid),
  153:     exit(BootPid, kill),
  154: 
  155:     ok.
  156: 
  157: get_modules_sorted(Ms, Process, Path) ->
  158:     case erl_prim_loader:get_modules(Ms, Process, Path) of
  159: 	{ok,{Succ,FailExp}} ->
  160: 	    {ok,{lists:sort(Succ),lists:sort(FailExp)}};
  161: 	Other ->
  162: 	    Other
  163:     end.
  164: 
  165: normalize_and_backslash(Config) ->
  166:     %% Test OTP-11170
  167:     case os:type() of
  168: 	{win32,_} ->
  169: 	    {skip, "not on windows"};
  170: 	_ ->
  171: 	    test_normalize_and_backslash(Config)
  172:     end.
  173: test_normalize_and_backslash(Config) ->
  174:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  175:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir,"\\"),
  176:     File = filename:join(Dir,"file-OTP-11170"),
  177:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  178:     ok = file:write_file(File,"a file to test OTP-11170"),
  179:     {ok,["file-OTP-11170"]} = file:list_dir(Dir),
  180:     {ok,["file-OTP-11170"]} = erl_prim_loader:list_dir(Dir),
  181:     ok = file:delete(File),
  182:     ok = file:del_dir(Dir),
  183:     ok.
  184: 
  185: %% Start a node using the 'inet' loading method,
  186: %% from an already started boot server.
  187: inet_existing(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  188:     BootPid = start_boot_server(),
  189:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(start_node_using_inet_args()),
  190:     {ok,[["inet"]]} = rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [loader]),
  191:     peer:stop(Peer),
  192:     unlink(BootPid),
  193:     exit(BootPid, kill),
  194:     ok.
  195: 
  196: %% Start a node using the 'inet' loading method,
  197: %% but start the boot server afterwards.
  198: inet_coming_up(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  199:     {ok, Peer} = ?CT_PEER(#{wait_boot => false, connection => standard_io,
  200:         args => start_node_using_inet_args()}),
  201: 
  202:     %% Wait a while, then start boot server, and wait for node to start.
  203:     ct:sleep({seconds,6}),
  204:     BootPid = start_boot_server(),
  205:     Node = wait_really_started(Peer, 25),
  206: 
  207:     %% Check loader argument, then cleanup.
  208:     {ok,[["inet"]]} = rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [loader]),
  209:     peer:stop(Peer),
  210:     unlink(BootPid),
  211:     exit(BootPid, kill),
  212:     ok.
  213: 
  214: wait_really_started(Peer, 0) ->
  215:     ct:fail({not_booted,Peer});
  216: wait_really_started(Peer, N) ->
  217:     case (catch peer:call(Peer, init, get_status, [])) of
  218:         {started, _} ->
  219:             peer:call(Peer, erlang, node, []);
  220:         _ ->
  221:             ct:sleep(1000),
  222:             wait_really_started(Peer, N - 1)
  223:     end.
  224: 
  225: %% Start a node using the 'inet' loading method,
  226: %% then lose the connection.
  227: inet_disconnects(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  228:     BootPid = start_boot_server(),
  229:     unlink(BootPid),
  230:     Self = self(),
  231: 
  232:     %% This process shuts down the boot server during loading.
  233:     Stopper = spawn_link(fun() -> stop_boot(BootPid, Self) end),
  234:     receive
  235:         {Stopper,ready} -> ok
  236:     end,
  237: 
  238:     %% Let the loading begin...
  239:     {ok,Peer} = ?CT_PEER(#{wait_boot => false, connection => 0,
  240:         args => start_node_using_inet_args()}),
  241: 
  242:     %% When the stopper is ready, the slave node should be
  243:     %% looking for a boot server again.
  244:     receive
  245:         {Stopper,ok} ->
  246:             ok;
  247:         {Stopper,{error,Reason}} ->
  248:             ct:fail(Reason)
  249:     after 60000 ->
  250:             ct:fail(stopper_died)
  251:     end,
  252: 
  253:     %% Start new boot server to see that loading is continued.
  254:     BootPid2 = start_boot_server(),
  255:     Node = wait_really_started(Peer, 25),
  256:     {ok,[["inet"]]} = rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [loader]),
  257:     peer:stop(Peer),
  258:     unlink(BootPid2),
  259:     exit(BootPid2, kill),
  260:     ok.
  261: 
  262: %% Trace boot server calls and stop the server before loading is finished.
  263: stop_boot(BootPid, Super) ->
  264:     erlang:trace(all, true, [call]),
  265:     1 = erlang:trace_pattern({erl_boot_server,send_file_result,3}, true, [local]),
  266:     BootRef = erlang:monitor(process, BootPid),
  267:     Super ! {self(),ready},
  268:     Result = get_calls(100, BootPid),
  269:     exit(BootPid, kill),
  270:     erlang:trace_pattern({erl_boot_server,send_file_result,3}, false, [local]),
  271:     erlang:trace(all, false, [call]),
  272:     receive
  273: 	{'DOWN',BootRef,_,_, killed} -> ok
  274:     end,
  275:     Super ! {self(),Result}.    
  276: 
  277: get_calls(0, _) ->
  278:     ok;
  279: get_calls(Count, Pid) ->
  280:     receive
  281: 	{trace,_,call,_MFA} ->
  282: 	    get_calls(Count-1, Pid)
  283:     after 10000 ->
  284: 	    {error,{trace_msg_timeout,Count}}
  285:     end.	
  286: 
  287: %% Start nodes in parallel, all using the 'inet' loading method;
  288: %% verify that the boot server manages.
  289: multiple_slaves(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  290:     Args = start_node_using_inet_args(),
  291: 
  292:     NoOfNodes = 10,			% no of slave nodes to be started
  293: 
  294:     Peers = [?CT_PEER(#{wait_boot => {self(), tag}, args => Args}) || _ <- lists:seq(1, NoOfNodes)],
  295: 
  296:     %% "queue up" the nodes to wait for the boot server to respond
  297:     %% (note: test_server supervises each node start by accept()
  298:     %% on a socket, the timeout value for the accept has to be quite 
  299:     %% long for this test to work).
  300:     ct:sleep({seconds,5}),
  301:     %% start the code loading circus!
  302:     BootPid = start_boot_server(),
  303:     %% give the nodes a chance to boot up before attempting to stop them
  304:     ct:sleep({seconds,10}),
  305: 
  306:     %% wait for all nodes to complete boot process, get their names:
  307:     [
  308:         receive
  309:             {tag, {started, Node, Peer}} ->
  310:                 {ok,[["inet"]]} = rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [loader])
  311:         end
  312:         || {ok, Peer} <- Peers
  313:     ],
  314:     [peer:stop(Peer) || {ok, Peer} <- Peers],
  315: 
  316:     unlink(BootPid),
  317:     exit(BootPid, kill),
  318:     ok.
  319: 
  320: 
  321: %% Start a node using the 'inet' loading method,
  322: %% verify that the boot server responds to file requests.
  323: file_requests(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  324:     {ok, Peer, Node, BootPid} = complete_start_node(),
  325: 
  326:     %% compare with results from file server calls (the
  327:     %% boot server uses the same file sys and cwd)
  328:     {ok,Files} = file:list_dir("."),
  329:     io:format("Files: ~p~n",[Files]),
  330:     {ok,Files} = rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader, list_dir, ["."]),
  331:     {ok,Info} = file:read_file_info(code:which(test_server)),
  332:     {ok,Info} = rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader, read_file_info,
  333: 			 [code:which(test_server)]),
  334: 
  335:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  336:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir,?MODULE_STRING++"_file_requests"),
  337:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  338:     Alias = filename:join(Dir,"symlink"),
  339:     case file:make_symlink(code:which(test_server), Alias) of
  340: 	{error, enotsup} ->
  341: 	    %% Links not supported on this platform
  342: 	    ok;
  343: 	{error, eperm} ->
  344: 	    {win32,_} = os:type(),
  345: 	    %% Windows user not privileged to create symlinks"
  346: 	    ok;
  347: 	ok ->
  348: 	    %% Reading file info for link should return file info for
  349: 	    %% link target
  350: 	    {ok,Info} = rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader, read_file_info,
  351: 				 [Alias]),
  352: 	    #file_info{type=regular} = Info,
  353: 	    {ok,#file_info{type=symlink}} =
  354: 		rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader, read_link_info,
  355: 			 [Alias])
  356:     end,
  357: 
  358:     {ok,Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
  359:     {ok,Cwd} = rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader, get_cwd, []),
  360:     case file:get_cwd("C:") of
  361: 	{error,enotsup} ->
  362: 	    ok;
  363: 	{ok,DCwd} ->
  364: 	    {ok,DCwd} = rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader, get_cwd, ["C:"])
  365:     end,
  366: 
  367:     peer:stop(Peer),
  368:     unlink(BootPid),
  369:     exit(BootPid, kill),
  370:     ok.
  371: 
  372: %% Read files from local archive.
  373: local_archive(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  374:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  375:     KernelDir = filename:basename(code:lib_dir(kernel)),
  376:     Archive = filename:join([PrivDir, KernelDir ++ init:archive_extension()]),
  377:     file:delete(Archive),
  378:     {ok, Archive} = create_archive(Archive, [KernelDir]),
  379: 
  380:     Node = node(),
  381:     BeamName = "inet.beam",
  382:     ok = test_archive(Node, Archive, KernelDir, BeamName),
  383: 
  384:     %% Cleanup
  385:     ok = rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader, purge_archive_cache, []),
  386:     ok = file:delete(Archive),
  387:     ok.
  388: 
  389: %% Read files from remote archive.
  390: remote_archive(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  391:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  392:     KernelDir = filename:basename(code:lib_dir(kernel)),
  393:     Archive = filename:join([PrivDir, KernelDir ++ init:archive_extension()]),
  394:     file:delete(Archive),
  395:     {ok, Archive} = create_archive(Archive, [KernelDir]),
  396: 
  397:     {ok, Peer, Node, BootPid} = complete_start_node(),
  398: 
  399:     BeamName = "inet.beam",
  400:     ok = test_archive(Node, Archive, KernelDir, BeamName),
  401: 
  402:     %% Cleanup
  403:     peer:stop(Peer),
  404:     unlink(BootPid),
  405:     exit(BootPid, kill),
  406:     ok.
  407: 
  408: %% Read files from primary archive.
  409: primary_archive(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  410:     %% Copy the orig files to priv_dir
  411:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  412:     Archive = filename:join([PrivDir, "primary_archive.zip"]),
  413:     file:delete(Archive),
  414:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  415:     {ok, _} = zip:create(Archive, ["primary_archive"],
  416: 			 [{compress, []}, {cwd, DataDir}]),
  417:     {ok, _} = zip:extract(Archive, [{cwd, PrivDir}]),
  418:     TopDir = filename:join([PrivDir, "primary_archive"]),
  419: 
  420:     %% Compile the code
  421:     DictDir = "primary_archive_dict-1.0",
  422:     DummyDir = "primary_archive_dummy",
  423:     ok = compile_app(TopDir, DictDir),
  424:     ok = compile_app(TopDir, DummyDir),
  425: 
  426:     %% Create the archive
  427:     {ok, TopFiles} = file:list_dir(TopDir),
  428:     {ok, {_, ArchiveBin}} = zip:create(Archive, TopFiles,
  429: 				       [memory, {compress, []}, {cwd, TopDir}]),
  430: 
  431:     %% Use temporary node to simplify cleanup
  432:     {ok,Peer,Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  433:     {_,_,_} = rpc:call(Node, erlang, date, []),
  434: 
  435:     %% Set primary archive 
  436:     ExpectedEbins = [Archive, DictDir ++ "/ebin", DummyDir ++ "/ebin"],
  437:     io:format("ExpectedEbins: ~p\n", [ExpectedEbins]),
  438:     {ok, FileInfo} = ?PRIM_FILE:read_file_info(Archive),
  439:     {ok, Ebins} = rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader, set_primary_archive,
  440: 			   [Archive, ArchiveBin, FileInfo,
  441: 			    fun escript:parse_file/1]),
  442:     ExpectedEbins = lists:sort(Ebins), % assert
  443: 
  444:     {ok, TopFiles2} = rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader, list_dir, [Archive]),
  445:     [DictDir, DummyDir] = lists:sort(TopFiles2),
  446:     BeamName = "primary_archive_dict_app.beam",
  447:     ok = test_archive(Node, Archive, DictDir, BeamName),
  448: 
  449:     %% Cleanup
  450:     {ok, []} = rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader, set_primary_archive,
  451: 			[undefined, undefined, undefined,
  452: 			 fun escript:parse_file/1]),
  453:     peer:stop(Peer),
  454:     ok = file:delete(Archive),
  455:     ok.
  456: 
  457: test_archive(Node, TopDir, AppDir, BeamName) ->
  458:     %% List dir
  459:     io:format("test_archive: ~p\n", [rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader, list_dir, [TopDir])]),
  460:     {ok, TopFiles} = rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader, list_dir, [TopDir]),
  461:     true = lists:member(AppDir, TopFiles),
  462:     AbsAppDir = TopDir ++ "/" ++ AppDir,
  463:     {ok, AppFiles} = rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader, list_dir, [AbsAppDir]),
  464:     true = lists:member("ebin", AppFiles),
  465:     Ebin = AbsAppDir ++ "/ebin",
  466:     {ok, EbinFiles} = rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader, list_dir, [Ebin]),
  467:     Beam = Ebin ++ "/" ++ BeamName,
  468:     true = lists:member(BeamName, EbinFiles),
  469:     error = rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader, list_dir, [TopDir ++ "/no_such_file"]),
  470:     error = rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader, list_dir, [TopDir ++ "/ebin/no_such_file"]),
  471: 
  472:     %% File info
  473:     {ok, #file_info{type = directory}} =
  474: 	rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader, read_file_info, [TopDir]),
  475:     {ok, #file_info{type = directory}} =
  476: 	rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader, read_file_info, [Ebin]),
  477:     {ok, #file_info{type = regular} = FI}  =
  478: 	rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader, read_file_info, [Beam]),
  479:     error = rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader, read_file_info, [TopDir ++ "/no_such_file"]),
  480:     error = rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader, read_file_info, [TopDir ++ "/ebin/no_such_file"]),
  481: 
  482:     %% Get file
  483:     {ok, Bin, Beam} = rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader, get_file, [Beam]),
  484:     if
  485: 	FI#file_info.size =:= byte_size(Bin) -> ok;
  486: 	true -> exit({FI#file_info.size, byte_size(Bin)})
  487:     end,
  488:     error = rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader, get_file, ["/no_such_file"]),
  489:     error = rpc:call(Node, erl_prim_loader, get_file, ["/ebin/no_such_file"]),
  490:     ok.
  491: 
  492: create_archive(Archive, AppDirs) ->
  493:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
  494:     Opts = [{compress, []}, {cwd, LibDir}],
  495:     io:format("zip:create(~p,\n\t~p,\n\t~p).\n", [Archive, AppDirs, Opts]),
  496:     zip:create(Archive, AppDirs, Opts).
  497: 
  498: 
  499: %% Read virtual directories from archive.
  500: virtual_dir_in_archive(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  501:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  502:     Data = <<"A little piece of data.">>,
  503:     ArchiveBase = "archive_with_virtual_dirs",
  504:     Archive = filename:join([PrivDir, ArchiveBase ++ init:archive_extension()]),
  505:     FileBase = "a_data_file.beam",
  506:     EbinBase = "ebin",
  507:     FileInArchive = filename:join([ArchiveBase, EbinBase, FileBase]),
  508:     BinFiles = [{FileInArchive, Data}],
  509:     Opts = [{compress, []}],
  510:     file:delete(Archive),
  511:     io:format("zip:create(~p,\n\t~p,\n\t~p).\n", [Archive, BinFiles, Opts]),
  512:     {ok, Archive} = zip:create(Archive, BinFiles, Opts),
  513: 
  514:     %% Verify that there is no directories
  515:     {ok, BinFiles} = zip:unzip(Archive, [memory]),
  516: 
  517:     FullPath = filename:join([Archive, FileInArchive]),
  518:     {ok, _} = erl_prim_loader:read_file_info(FullPath),
  519: 
  520:     %% Read one virtual dir
  521:     EbinDir = filename:dirname(FullPath),
  522:     {ok, _} = erl_prim_loader:read_file_info(EbinDir),
  523:     {ok, [FileBase]} = erl_prim_loader:list_dir(EbinDir),
  524: 
  525:     %% Read another virtual dir
  526:     AppDir = filename:dirname(EbinDir),
  527:     {ok, _} = erl_prim_loader:read_file_info(AppDir),
  528:     {ok, [EbinBase]} = erl_prim_loader:list_dir(AppDir),
  529: 
  530:     %% Cleanup
  531:     ok = erl_prim_loader:purge_archive_cache(),
  532:     ok = file:delete(Archive),
  533:     ok.
  534: 
  535: %%%
  536: %%% Helper functions.
  537: %%%
  538: 
  539: complete_start_node() ->
  540:     BootPid = start_boot_server(),
  541:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(start_node_using_inet_args()),
  542:     {ok, Peer, Node, BootPid}.
  543: 
  544: start_boot_server() ->
  545:     %% Many linux systems define:
  546:     %%   127.0.0.1 localhost
  547:     %%   127.0.1.1 somehostname
  548:     %% Therefore, to allow the tests to work on those kind of systems,
  549:     %% also include "localhost" in the list of allowed hosts.
  550: 
  551:     Hosts = [host(),ip_str("localhost")],
  552:     {ok,BootPid} = erl_boot_server:start_link(Hosts),
  553:     BootPid.
  554: 
  555: start_node_using_inet_args() ->
  556:     IpStr = ip_str(host()),
  557:     ["-loader", "inet", "-hosts", IpStr].
  558: 
  559: 
  560: ip_str({A, B, C, D}) ->
  561:     lists:concat([A, ".", B, ".", C, ".", D]);
  562: ip_str(Host) ->
  563:     {ok,Ip} = inet:getaddr(Host, inet),
  564:     ip_str(Ip).
  565: 
  566: host() ->
  567:     {ok,Host} = inet:gethostname(),
  568:     Host.
  569: 
  570: compile_app(TopDir, AppName) ->
  571:     AppDir = filename:join([TopDir, AppName]),
  572:     SrcDir = filename:join([AppDir, "src"]),
  573:     OutDir = filename:join([AppDir, "ebin"]),
  574:     {ok, Files} = file:list_dir(SrcDir),
  575:     compile_files(Files, SrcDir, OutDir).
  576: 
  577: compile_files([File | Files], SrcDir, OutDir) ->
  578:     case filename:extension(File) of
  579: 	".erl" ->
  580: 	    AbsFile = filename:join([SrcDir, File]),
  581: 	    case compile:file(AbsFile, [{outdir, OutDir}]) of
  582: 		{ok, _Mod} ->
  583: 		    compile_files(Files, SrcDir, OutDir);
  584: 		Error ->
  585: 		    {compilation_error, AbsFile, OutDir, Error}
  586: 	    end;
  587: 	_ ->
  588: 	    compile_files(Files, SrcDir, OutDir)
  589:     end;
  590: compile_files([], _, _) ->
  591:     ok.
  592:
